intro: Carolinea, commonly known as the Carolinean heath, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes species like blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and limestone regions. Due to its limited distribution, Carolinea is considered a rare and endangered species.
